properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 4 at 2:30AM MST until February 7 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
...The first of two storms expected to arrive Wednesday night...

.A prolonged period of snow will affect portions of Central and
Southwest MT from Wednesday night into Friday. A second storm
system is likely to affect the same region over the weekend, with
additional snow accumulations.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations 6 to 12
inches between 4000 feet and 7000 feet, with 12 to 24 inches
above 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Portions of central, southwest and west central Montana,
not including the cities of Great Falls, Townsend, or Dillon.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through late Thursday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
